New Records: Ross Adair became just the third Irish men’s player to hit a T20I century
Ireland’s 195-6 is their highest T20I score against South Africa and 10th best of all-time in the format
Their 137-run stand for the first wicket is also Ireland’s second-biggest T20I partnership
Key Match Events: Ross Adair hit nine sixes and five fours in his knock of 100 from just 58 deliveries
Mark Adair’s 4-31 with the ball claimed a dramatic 10-run win
Matthew Humphreys took 3-25 in South Africa’s final over
Post-Match Reflections: Adair’s innings was brutal, the 30-year-old hitting nine sixes and five fours in his knock of 100 from just 58 deliveries
Stirling played superbly himself with a rapid 52 off 31 balls – the Ireland skipper’s 24th half century in T20Is
Miscellaneous Highlights: The younger Adair and Neil Rock soon combined to account for Tristan Stubbs
Matthew Breetzke passed 50 and took South Africa to within 23 runs of victory with 12 balls remaining
